control of one organization um so for example Open DNS with many servers and
prefixes is one autonomous system Facebook is one Microsoft is one so on and so forth um e autonomous system is
identified by a number so sometimes you hear the term ASN which stands for as number um so for example op DNS is 36692
these are just numbers assigned to to you by R Aon Etc and then each
autonomous system each dot in this graph announces one or more ipv4 or IPv6
prefixes so we have this big graph they're all connected to each other because obviously if you're just one
autonomous system you're not really an internet you're a network but you're not connect to the rest of the network so you need to be connected to at least one
other provider typically a service provider or you know in a better case you're connected to multiple of them and
then each autonomous system announces one or more prefixes so now imagine that you're on like the left hand side of
this graph and you need to go to the right hand side because that's where Google lives or Facebook uh you need to figure out how to get there um and
that's where bgp comes into play bgp is the rounding protocol used on the internet and um it's used to announce
which prefixes exist and how you get there and basically um you can build this graph your routers build graphs
